meanings.definition: A type of tree commonly found in Scotland.
meanings.sent1: The brughs in the forest provided shade and shelter for the animals.
meanings.sent2: I love the smell of brughs in the air during a walk in the Scottish countryside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels played hide-and-seek among the brughs, peeking out from behind the branches.
meanings.sent4: The brughs stood tall like guardians of the forest, their branches reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The rustling of the brughs in the wind created a soothing melody in the woods.

meanings.definition: To make a low, guttural sound, as a pig does.
meanings.sent1: The pig started to brughs loudly when it saw the farmer approaching with food.
meanings.sent2: The old dog would brughs happily whenever its owner returned home.
meanings.sent3: The baby tried to imitate the pig and ended up making funny brughs noises.
meanings.sent4: The engine of the old car began to brughs as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to brughs through the cracks in the window on stormy nights.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the Scottish Highlands.
meanings.sent1: She wore a traditional brughs tartan skirt to celebrate her Scottish heritage.
meanings.sent2: The brughs music playing in the background set the perfect mood for the Highland dance.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin was decorated with brughs patterns and pictures of the Highlands.
meanings.sent4: His accent had a distinct brughs lilt that reminded me of the rolling hills of Scotland.
meanings.sent5: The landscape was painted in shades of green and brown, typical of the brughs countryside.
